pageProps.contentHtml:
Lebesgue differentiation theorem

Let μ\muμ be a finite positive Borel measure on R\RR that is singular to Lebesgue measure. Show that

lim⁡r→0+μ([x−r,x+r])2r=∞\lim_{r\to0^+}\frac{\mu\p{\br{x - r, x+ r}}}{2r} = \inftyr→0+lim​2rμ([x−r,x+r])​=∞

for μ\muμ-almost every x∈Rx \in \Rx∈R.
Solution.

Since μ\muμ is singular with respect to Lebesgue measure (which we denote mmm), there exists S⊆RS \subseteq \RS⊆R Borel such that μ(S)=0\mu\p{S} = 0μ(S)=0 and m(Sc)=0m\p{S^\comp} = 0m(Sc)=0. For k∈Nk \in \Nk∈N, let

Ek={x∈Sc | lim sup⁡r→0+μ(B(x,r))m(B(x,r))<1k}.E_k = \set{x \in S^\comp \st \limsup_{r\to0^+} \frac{\mu\p{B\p{x, r}}}{m\p{B\p{x, r}}} < \frac{1}{k}}.Ek​={x∈Sc∣∣​r→0+limsup​m(B(x,r))μ(B(x,r))​<k1​}.

Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. By regularity of the Lebesgue measure, there exists an open set U⊇ScU \supseteq S^\compU⊇Sc such that

m(U)≤m(U∖Sc)<ε.m\p{U} \leq m\p{U \setminus S^\comp} < \epsilon.m(U)≤m(U∖Sc)<ε.

For any x∈Ekx \in E_kx∈Ek​, there exists an rx>0r_x > 0rx​>0 so that B(x,rx)⊆UB\p{x, r_x} \subseteq UB(x,rx​)⊆U (since UUU is open) and

μ(B(x,5rx))m(B(x,5rx))<1k,\frac{\mu\p{B\p{x, 5r_x}}}{m\p{B\p{x, 5r_x}}} < \frac{1}{k},m(B(x,5rx​))μ(B(x,5rx​))​<k1​,

by definition of EkE_kEk​. By the Vitali covering lemma, there exists a subset {xn}n⊆Ek\set{x_n}_n \subseteq E_k{xn​}n​⊆Ek​ such that

⋃x∈ScB(x,rx)⊆⋃n=1∞B(xn,5rn),\bigcup_{x \in S^\comp} B\p{x, r_x} \subseteq \bigcup_{n=1}^\infty B\p{x_n, 5r_n},x∈Sc⋃​B(x,rx​)⊆n=1⋃∞​B(xn​,5rn​),

where rn=rxnr_n = r_{x_n}rn​=rxn​​ and {B(xn,rn)}n\set{B\p{x_n, r_n}}_n{B(xn​,rn​)}n​ are pairwise disjoint. Hence,

μ(Sc)≤μ(⋃x∈ScB(x,rx))≤μ(⋃n=1∞B(x,5rn))≤∑n=1∞μ(B(xn,5rn))≤1k∑n=1∞m(B(xn,5rn))(xn∈Ek)=5km(⋃n=1∞B(xn,rn))(B(xn,rn) are disjoint)≤5km(U)≤5εk.\begin{aligned} \mu\p{S^\comp} &\leq \mu\p{\bigcup_{x \in S^\comp} B\p{x, r_x}} \\ &\leq \mu\p{\bigcup_{n=1}^\infty B\p{x, 5r_n}} \\ &\leq \sum_{n=1}^\infty \mu\p{B\p{x_n, 5r_n}} \\ &\leq \frac{1}{k}\sum_{n=1}^\infty m\p{B\p{x_n, 5r_n}} && \p{x_n \in E_k} \\ &= \frac{5}{k} m\p{\bigcup_{n=1}^\infty B\p{x_n, r_n}} && \p{B\p{x_n, r_n} \text{ are disjoint}} \\ &\leq \frac{5}{k} m\p{U} \\ &\leq \frac{5\epsilon}{k}. \end{aligned}μ(Sc)​≤μ(x∈Sc⋃​B(x,rx​))≤μ(n=1⋃∞​B(x,5rn​))≤n=1∑∞​μ(B(xn​,5rn​))≤k1​n=1∑∞​m(B(xn​,5rn​))=k5​m(n=1⋃∞​B(xn​,rn​))≤k5​m(U)≤k5ε​.​​(xn​∈Ek​)(B(xn​,rn​) are disjoint)​

Hence, μ(Ek)=0\mu\p{E_k} = 0μ(Ek​)=0 for all kkk, so on ScS^\compSc, the limit holds μ\muμ-almost everywhere, hence μ\muμ-almost everywhere on R\RR since μ(S)=0\mu\p{S} = 0μ(S)=0.
